verses.verse: {The Book of} {Joel} d {The Coming Invasion} d This message from the Lord came to Pethuel's son Joel. {The Heb. name Joel means The Lord is God}

"Hear this, you elders! Listen, all of you residents of the land! Has there ever been anything like this during your lifetime, {Lit. this in your days} or even when your ancestors were alive? {Lit. even in the days of your ancestors}
Pass it on to your children, and from {The Heb. lacks from} your children to their children, and from {The Heb. lacks from} their children to the following generation.

Whatever the devouring locust left behind the locust swarm has consumed! Whatever the locust swarm has left behind, the young locust {Or caterpillar} has consumed! Whatever the young locust {Or caterpillar} has left behind, the ravaging locust has consumed!"
{A Call to Mourning} d "Wake up, you drunkards! Cry aloud and howl, you wine drinkers, because your supply of new wine has been snatched from you. {Lit. from your lips}
Indeed, a nation has invaded my land it is strong and its population is too large to count {Lit. and innumerable} with teeth like a lion and fangs {Or jaws} like a lioness.
That nation {Lit. It} laid waste my vines, and stripped bare my fig tree, discarding it. It stripped off {Lit. made white} its bark.
"Grieve like a virgin, who, dressed in her mourner's clothes, {Or in sackcloth} cries out in memory {The Heb. lacks in memory} of the man she was going to marry. {Lit. the husband of her youth}
Both grain offering and wine offering have been removed from the Lord's Temple; {Or house ; and so throughout the book} the priests and ministering servants of the Lord are mourning."
{The Coming Famine} d "The fields lie in ruins and the ground is dried up. {Or ground mourns} Indeed, the grain is ruined, the new wine has evaporated, and the olive oil has run out.
Be dismayed, you farmers! Cry aloud, you vintners, for the wheat and barley, because the harvest in your fields has been lost.

The grapevine is shriveled and the fig tree is withered, along with the pomegranate tree, the palm tree, the apple tree and all of the cultivated trees. {Lit. the trees of the field} Truly, joy has evaporated from Adam's children." {Lit. from sons of mankind}

{A Call to Mourn and Repent} d "Put on your mourning clothes, you priests; and cry aloud, you ministering servants at the altar! Come! Stay the night in mourner's clothes, {Or in sackcloth} you ministers of my God, because the grain offering and the wine offering is held back from the Temple of your God.
Set apart time for a fast! Call a solemn assembly! Gather the elders and everyone living in the land to the Temple of the Lord your God, and cry out to the Lord !"
{A Lament about the Day of the Lord} d Oh, no! For the Day of the Lord approaches, and like destruction from the Almighty, it will come!
Isn't our food supply cut off right in front of us, {Lit. cut off before our eyes} along with joy and gladness from the Temple of our God?
Seeds shrivel within their furrows, the storehouses lie empty, and granaries stand in ruins because the grain has withered.
Oh, how the livestock groan! The herds of cattle {Or oxen} wander about because they have no pasture. Even flocks of sheep suffer!
To you, Lord , I cry out, because fire has devoured the open pastures, and has set all the cultivated trees {Lit. the trees of the field} ablaze.
The livestock also cries out to you, because their water sources have evaporated and because fire has consumed the open pastures.
